oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of compost fertilization and wheat cultivar on uptake of a range of nutrients and trace elements
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rasmussen, Camilla Ruø
Dresbøll, Dorte Bodin
Thorup-Kristensen, Kristian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic farms often rely on import of manure from conventional farms to secure sufficient nutrient supply to obtain sufficient yields and yield quality. In Denmark and other countries plans to phase out manure import from conventional farms, makes it increasingly difficult to secure plant nutrients for organic crops. However phasing out conventional input to organic farms enhance the environmental lead of organic farming practices over conventional and can increase the trustworthiness of organic farming among consumers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Rasmussen, Camilla Ruø; Dresbøll, Dorte Bodin and Thorup-Kristensen, Kristian (2015) Effects of compost fertilization and wheat cultivar on uptake of a range of nutrients and trace elements. [draft]
